Yes,the new panel will need to be in a slightly different location. Current code requires a 30 wide by 36" deep space in front of the panel. In theory it should forever be empty of everything (i.e., no storage). But the crucial part is that there should be no fixed items in that space, such as sinks, shelving, appliances, etc.
Your current panel appears to be inset between two studs. Depending on a number of factors, it may be easier to surface mount the new panel next to it, rather than having to run all the cables inside the wall, but that may depend on access from the other side or other factors.
Your panel looks to be a Stab Lok panel, which is considered by many to be a major fire hazard. Replacement with a modern panel is a good idea, even if you don't need the EV charging yet Take a Selfie and Upload Update Welcome to Complaints Materials New Material Raising Request Material Available Stock Change Operator code New Indent Indent List Assigned Materials Expenses Leave Required Material Inventory Name Available Qty Return Qty IndentRaisingActivity Required On : Remarks SUBMIT Remarks Is material Used ?
